column4: hi, is there a channel where i could get help using testdisk to recover my data from a usb harddisk? i can see the data, but i can not copy them (no space) cant i just "apply" the found partitions? It does not work for me and i dont know why ...
what means that you cannot copy them?
it seems incredibly slow and its about 200G
dmesg what say? there are errors releted to disk?
yes ... (its on other pc so cant copy)   "Buffer IO error on device sdc"
testdisk lists  partitions and files fine though
you can try do use dd_rescue to make a bit a bit image to another position, then try to mount with loop option
ddrescue  will make "the whole thing" image? i mean if there is 500G data  it will be a 500G image?
no, if your disk is 200GB the image is 200GB also if only 10MB of data is present
ubuntu says i would have to go to win and run checkntfs (or so) but in windows i only get to "formath hd?"
its a 1000G usb drive and i dont have enough space for that 8(
you can try fsck.ntfs in ubuntu
you can try fsck.ntfs in ubuntu
you can try fsck.ntfs , and then try to mount
if don't work the only thing to do is use dd_rescue , ask friends for a disk of 1TB
thanks, i will, do you know what package is fsck.ntfs in?
